reviews.text: We were taken to this restaurant /Cafe by our Singaporean hosts for business lunch on a Friday. Menu has plenty of different options and I had the opportunity to try number of them. All dishes that I tried were delicious, steak I ordered was done the way it was requested. It has a warm and casual welcoming atmosphere.

The food is excellent, complemented by a pleasant ambience and good service staff.
I have been there several times (on almost every Wednesday since January 2025 as I enjoy the particular pair of musicians' performances) and ate quite a variety of dishes from their menu.
Last night, I ordered the bacon mushroom bombs and oven baked cheese nachos. I have posted a picture of the bacon mushroom bombs here.

Suggest to book beforehand - was lucky to have gotten a table, but saw that they had to turn away some people as the tables were reserved.

Satay is a must try! Meat was well seasoned and tender, and coupled with the sauce - UMPH!
The Tom yum pasta was creamy and a bit spicy; gotta it eat before it gets cold and heavy.

Food wise - as expected. But the salt and pepper calamari that it claims, I didn't taste much of it, but more of spice powder rather than salt and pepper and the overly battered.

Service wise - as expected, they are attentive and quick to react.

Atmosphere wise - would be perfect if I knew that the live band only perform on wed and fri.

Overall, would visit again for the ambience and warmlyness. But would be on a live band performance day.

is a perfect for a relaxed, chill night out. The ambiance is cozy and inviting, with a good selection of food and drinks. and the food was a nice surpriseâ€”the truffle fries were especially tasty. Service was friendly and attentive, making the whole experience feel easygoing yet satisfying. Great spot to unwind with good drinks and bites!
